name: Into The Gloom
description: Be prepared for the horror, and to run for your life, in this pixel style horror adventure featuring five possible endings!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: 1.6 GHz or better Memory: 512 MB RAM Graphics: 256 MB VRAM Storage: 160 MB available space Additional Notes: Headphones recommended
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7/8/8.1 Processor: 2.0 GHz dual core or equivalent Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 512 MB VRAM Storage: 160 MB available space Additional Notes: Headphones recommended

reviews.review_text: this is the best pixel horror game there is out there it. it's has 5 endings, i have played 2 hours almost three now and i only found 1 ending, i mean it's only 3 bucks of you dont like it then you're not wasting much.     i recommend it if you a fan of pixel horror.

Worth way more than $2.99. The devs undersold themselves. I'd happily pay $8-$10 for this and I think you would too.  One of the best indie horror games I've ever played. Amazing sound considering creative commons, amazing environment and feel.  Regardless of the graphics (which I think adds a charm and cool factor), this game is genuinely scary.  Buy it now.

Into the Gloom is an atmospheric gem of a horror game. It has little to no jumpscares, and the ones it have are rare and not even loud, yet so effective since done right. Into the Gloom is also riddled with mind-boggling puzzles, which can be difficult if you miss some details; two puzzles for sure may even take up to 15-30 minutes to fully figure out. Despite being made in Unity engine, the environment is eerie and well set up, with a chilling and foreboding atmosphere. To top it off, Into the Gloom offers a detailed and complex story, which can guide you in getting the game's 5 endings. If longer horror games with lore puzzles and full of adventure is your thing, I highly recommend you to play Into the Gloom right now!

I'm spending more time solving nonsensical puzzles than all the claimed 'Jump Scares' this game has to offer. When I've got more time to waste, I may come back to this. To each their own. As it stands, it's not worth the time I've wasted on it as is.
music sp00ks me tf out and the story is pretty rad.  I'd like to see this game done with modern day graphics tbh. The pixels didn't bother me at all, but I feel that this game/concept deserves more.

So far after 15 minutes the game looks and works well but I encountered a bug (or atleast I think it is) where at the abacus of some sorts or puzzle, i was unable to proceed due to me not being able to access my menu with the given keys. I had the tile and evertything,however, nothing had worked. I hope that this is not a bug, or it is just my keyboard playing up.   Anyway,that is my review of into the Gloom, worse comes to worse i'll make another review on it.   4/10 for now
